intro: Phacelia douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia douglasii is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
